intro: Wyethia robusta, commonly known as the robust hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in prairies and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Wyethia robusta has alternate, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinator populations.
